story:
Once upon a time, in the lush and vibrant land of Sri Lanka, there was a kind and curious little girl named Thilini. Thilini's heart was filled with love for all living creatures, and she had a special place in her heart for the beautiful and diverse birds that graced the skies above her home.

One sunny day, as Thilini played in her garden, she noticed a small, injured bird with feathers of a brilliant shade of blue, lying on the ground. Thilini gently picked up the bird and noticed an injured wing. With a caring touch, she brought the bird inside and placed her in a basket lined with soft cloth. Thilini knew just what to do, for she had learned from her wise mother about how to care for injured animals.

Over the next few days, Thilini tended to the bird with great care, feeding her and making sure she had plenty of water. She would speak softly to the bird, telling her stories of the other birds she had seen throughout her young life, and of the great adventures they must have had soaring through the skies. Thilini's soothing words and loving touch began to heal the bird's injuries, and soon, the beautiful blue bird was able to flutter her wings once more.

The blue bird, whose name was Nilu, was incredibly grateful for Thilini's kindness and befriended her. As Nilu grew stronger, Thilini began to teach her how to fly. At first, Nilu was hesitant, having known nothing but fear and pain. But Thilini was patient and encouraging, and soon, Nilu was ready to take her first flight.

With Thilini watching with a mixture of excitement, hope, and just a touch of sadness, Nilu soared into the air, higher and higher. As she circled overhead, Thilini couldn't help but feel proud, not just for the bird but also for herself. She had saved a life and given it the gift of flight, and in doing so, she had discovered a strength she never knew she had.

Time passed, and Nilu would return often, always bringing with her new friends. It turned out that she was the princess of a magnificent bird kingdom, high in the peaks of the sacred Sri Pada Mountain. Word had spread about the little girl in the green fields who had saved Nilu, and the grateful birds couldn't help but return the favor with their own special gifts.

As the sun set each day, Thilini and Nilu would sit together on the branch of a tree, watching the sky change color and the stars begin to twinkle. Thilini would tell stories and sing songs, her words carried by the wind to the other birds in the sky. And Nilu would listen closely, her eyes bright with the love she held for her dear human friend.

The years went by, and the friendship between Thilini and Nilu remained unshakable. Thilini had grown into a talented, caring young woman, who would heal and help all manner of creatures. Nilu, though she remained a princess, had become more than that; her friendship had transcended the skies, and her love for Thilini had transformed her into a symbol of compassion and kindness.

As Thilini lay down for the night, her head filled with dreams of blue feathers, she couldn't wait for the new day to come. She knew that she would wake up with new stories to tell, new adventures to be had, and most importantly, a special friend who would always be by her side.

And even as a mother now, Thilini knows that the magical bond she formed with Nilu still exists, even if Nilu has had to continue her journey, exploring skies and lands beyond what Thilini could have ever imagined. The lessons Thilini learned from her time with Nilu remain with her, a compass that directs her towards hope, compassion, and unshakable friendship.

Now, as you close your eyes to sleep, remember Thilini and Nilu's enchanting tale of friendship. Dream of your own adventures and the many wonderful creatures you too can help and befriend. Goodnight, my dear one. May your dreams fly high, just like Nilu.
